documents.document: Never miss a good chance to shut up. -unknown
To be successful, you have to have your heart in your business & your business in your heart. -Thomas Watson
Forget mistakes. Forget failure. Forget everything except what you're going to do now and do it. Today is your lucky day. -Will Durant
All good is gained by those whose thought & life are kept pointed close to one main thing, not scattered upon a thousand. -McKenna
Excellence means when a man or woman asks of themselves more than others do. -Jose Ortega Y Gasset
An expert is a man who has made all the mistakes which can be made in a very narrow field. -Niels Bohr

The most important thing about getting somewhere is starting right where we are.
Bruce Bartonâ€¦ https://t.co/QF6M9Mlb5U
The lure of the distant & the difficult is deceptive. The great opportunity is where you are. -John Burroughs
Develop a passion for learning. If you do, you will never cease to grow. -Anthony J. D'Angelo
When you are in the valley, keep your goal firmly in view and you will get the renewed energy to continue the climb. -Denis Waitley
The biggest things are always the easiest to do because there is no competition. -Sir W.C. Van Horne
You've got to jump off cliffs and build your wings on the way down. -Ray Bradbury
"Everyone has a fair turn to be as great as he pleases." -Jeremy Collier
If little labour, little are our gains; Man's fortunes are according to his pains. -Robert Herrick
The shortest way to do many things is to do only one thing at a time. -Sydney Smiles
Example is the school of mankind, and they will learn at no other. - Edmund Burke
I have heard it said that the first ingredient of success -- the earliest spark in the dreamingâ€¦ https://t.co/JrFl9xrqZh
Anybody can do anything that he imagines. - Henry Ford
Always do your best. What you plant now, you will harvest later. - Og Mandino
People will sit up and take notice of you if you will sit up and take notice of what makes them sit up and take notice. -Frank Romer
Responsibilities gravitate to the person who can shoulder them. - Tom Stoppard
"I believe that the power to make money is a gift from God." -John D. Rockefeller
Nothing ventured, nothing gained...but if everything is ventured, and still nothing gained, give up & venture elsewhere. -Wastholm
You don't get in life what you want; you get in life what you are. -Les Brown
For true success ask yourself these four questions: Why? Why not? Why not me? Why notâ€¦ https://t.co/MznetlvV2R
I've found luck is quite predictable. If u want more luck, take more chances. B more active. Show up more often. -Brian Tracy
Whatever happens, take responsibility. - Tony Robbins
Great necessities call forth great leaders. -Abigail Adams
"Try not to become a man of success, but rather a man of value." -Albert Einstein
Have confidence that if you have done a little thing well, you can do a bigger thing well, too. -Joseph Storey
One does not discover new lands without consenting to lose sight of the shore for a very long time. -Andre Gide
If A equals success, then the formula is A=X + Y and Z, with X being work, Y play, and Z keeping your mouth shut. -Einstein
The reason why worry kills more people than work is that more people worry than work. -Robert Frost

If at first you don't succeed; you are running about average.
-M.H. Alderson, American soccerâ€¦ https://t.co/hmAKh7yk3b
"What is defeat? Nothing but education; nothing but the first step to something better." -Wendell Phillips
Sooner or later, those who win are those who think they can. - Richard Bach
If people knew what they had to do to be successful, most people wouldn't. -Lord Thomson of Fleet
I've got a great ambition to die of exhaustion rather than boredom. -Thomas Carlyle
27 Christmas Quotes to get you in the mood for Christmas ðŸŽ…ðŸŽ„https://t.co/dTnnBoepye
Have patience. All things are difficult before they become easy. - Saadi
The important work of moving the world forward does not wait to be done by perfect men. - George Eliot
Perseverance is failing 19 times and succeeding the 20th. -Julie Andrews
Whatever women do they must do twice as well as men to be thought half as good. Luckily, this is not difficult. -Charlotte Whitton
To fight fear, act. To increase fear...wait, put off, postpone. -David J. Schwartz
The great secret of success is to go through life as a man who never gets used up. - Albert Schweitzer
Everyone is trying to accomplish something big, not realizing that life is made up of little things. -Frank A. Clark
It is not in the pursuit of happiness that we find fulfillment, it is in the happiness of pursuit. -Denis Waitley
The ultimate goal of a more effective and efficient life is to provide you with enough time to enjoy some of it. -Michael LeBoeuf
It is well to be up before daybreak, for such habits contribute to health, wealth, and wisdom. -Aristotle
Very often we are our own worst enemy as we foolishly build stumbling blocks on the path that leads to success & happiness. -L. Binstock
If it were not for the company of fools, a witty man would often be greatly at a loss. -Rochefoucauld
You will never win if you never begin. -Robert H. Schuller
If you wish success in life, make perseverance your bosom friend. -Joseph Addison
There are thousands of reasons why you cannot do what you want to. All you need is one reason why you can. -Willis Whitney
Much unhappiness results from our inability to remember the nice things that happen to us. -W.N. Rieger
To have a great idea, have a lot of them. - Thomas Edison
I've got a great ambition to die of exhaustion rather than boredom. -Angus Grossart
Don't just read the easy stuff. You may be entertained by it, but you will never grow from it. -Jim Rohn
He that would be superior to external influences must first become superior to his own passions. -Samuel Johnson
Adversity has the effect of eliciting talents, which in prosperous circumstances would have lain dormant. -Horace
Have confidence that if you have done a little thing well, you can do a bigger thing well too. -David Storey
Every noble activity makes room for itself. -Ralph Waldo Emerson
Nobody grows old merely by living a number of years. We grow old by deserting our ideals. -Samuel Ullman
Look and you will find it; what is unsought will go undetected. -Sophocles (495-406 BC)
Difficulties are meant to rouse, not discourage. The human spirit is to grow strong by conflict. -William Ellery Channing
Your hopes, dreams & aspirations are legit. They are trying to take you airborne, above the clouds, above the storms, if you only let them. -W. James
Welcome the task that makes you go beyond yourself. -Frank McGee
You are here to enrich the world and you impoverish yourself if you forget that errand. -Woodrow Wilson
Never give up on a dream just because of the time it will take to accomplish it. The time will pass anyway. -Unknown
Today's opportunities erase yesterday's failures. -Gene Brown
"Success is 99% failure." -Soichiro Honda
Those who try and fail are much wiser than those who never try for fear of failure. -Andre Bustanoby
There will never be another now. I will make the most of today. There will never be another me. I will make the most of myself. -Schuller
Better to do something imperfectly than to do nothing flawlessly. -Robert Schuller
We seldom find people ungrateful so long as it is thought we can serve them. -Francois de La Rochefoucauld
The most splendid achievement of all is the constant striving to surpass yourself and to be worthy of your own approval. -Denis Waitley
Choose silence of all virtues, for by it you hear other men's imperfections, and conceal your own. -George Bernard Shaw
Those who bring sunshine into the lives of others, cannot keep it from themselves. -James M. Barrie
When any fit of gloominess lays hold upon you, make it a rule not to publish it by complaints. -Samuel Johnson
He who sacrifices his conscience to ambition burns a picture to obtain the ashes. -Chinese Proverb
You will never find time for anything. If you want the time, you must make it. -Charles Buxton
He who walks in the middle of the road gets hit from both sides. -George P. Schultz
Experience is a hard teacher because she gives the test first, the lesson afterwards. -Vernon Sanders Law
"Big shots are little shots who kept shooting." -Christopher Morley
The latter part of a wise person's life is occupied with curing the follies, prejudices and false opinions they contracted earlier. -Swift
"What you are must always displease you, if you would attain to that which you are not." -Saint Augustine
People wish to be settled. It is only as far as they are unsettled that there is any hope for them. -Emerson
There is a tendency for things to right themselves. -Ralph Waldo Emerson
I've always tried to go a step past wherever people expected me to end up. -Beverly Sills
Every man is a consumer and ought to be a producer. - Ralph Waldo Emerson
Little things console us, because little things afflict us. -Pascal
One must not lose desires. They are mighty stimulants to creativeness, to love, and to long life. -Alexander Bogomoletz
Decide what is worthwhile and follow through with it. Real success is finding your life work in the work that you love. -Colleen McCullough
The more wild & incredible your desire, the more willing & prompt God is in fulfilling it, if you will have it so. -C. Patmore
Time is more value than money. You can get more money, but you cannot get more time. - Jim Rohn
A man who is contented with what he has done will never become famous for what he will do. -Fred Estabrook
Let us not be too particular; it is better to have old secondhand diamonds than none at all. -Mark Twain
A learned fool is more foolish than an ignorant one. - MoliÃƒÂ¨re
The tendency to whining & complaining may be taken as the surest sign symptom of little souls & inferior intellects. -F. Jeffrey
Do your best every day and your life will gradually expand into satisfying fullness. -Horatio W. Dresser
